## Description {#details}

State for dereferenceable attribute.

Definition at line 4081 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### AccessedBytesMap {#a4df166621ea13df7d8c429d33f25ed7f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::map&lt;int64&#95;t, uint64&#95;t&gt; llvm::DerefState::AccessedBytesMap</>}>
Map representing for accessed memory offsets and sizes.

A key is Offset and a value is size. If there is a load/store instruction something like, p&#91;offset&#93; = v; (offset, sizeof(v)) will be inserted to this map. std::map is used because we want to iterate keys in ascending order.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l04105">4105</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### DerefBytesState {#a03477df647ac3e582403feb642e1ab22}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="IncIntegerState llvm::DerefState::DerefBytesState">
State representing for dereferenceable bytes.
